newsitem.title: FRANCE: BOXING-JOHNSTON SNATCHES CROWN FROM MENDY.
newsitem.headline: BOXING-JOHNSTON SNATCHES CROWN FROM MENDY.

text.p: American Steve Johnston snatched the World Boxing Council (WBC) lightweight title from French holder Jean-Baptiste Mendy in a divided points decision on Saturday.
The judges' cards gave Johnston, now unbeaten in 21 professional fights, victory by 117-114, 114-115, 116-114.
In a tight, technical bout, the Dakar-born Mendy, making his first defence since winning the vacant title last April, was too cautious in the early rounds.
He also had a penalty point for a foul when he opened a nasty cut in Johnston's right eyebrow in the fifth.
The American varied his rhythm but always attacked, managing to slip frequently inside the taller Frenchman's guard to score quick points.
He was too far ahead by the time the tiring 34-year-old Mendy, 10 years older than Johnston, tried to recover lost ground in the final three rounds.
Mendy's record now stands at 49 wins, six defeats and two ties in 57 pro fights.
